title: Unknown Microsoft Login Appearing in Saved Passwords
content:
Hi,

I recently noticed an unknown Outlook/Microsoft account (oliveconscious13@outlook.com) saved in my Firefox logins. The email and password appear to be randomly generated, and the account’s preferred language is set to Russian. I have never seen or used this account before.

Here are the key details:

My Firefox account was created on June 8, 2025.

The unknown Microsoft account was created on July 8, 2025.

I only have two devices connected to my Firefox account: my Mac (where the account first appeared) and my Windows PC.

The account is also showing up in Chrome’s saved passwords, which I never intentionally synced with Firefox.

This is a brand-new Mac purchased directly from Apple, so I know it wasn’t a used device.

I’m trying to figure out:

How this account was added to my saved logins.

Whether this was synced from another device.

If there’s any security concern or if my account may be compromised.

Could you check my sync history or logs to see which device added this login, and advise on how to make sure my saved logins are secure?
creator: davidxcandelier

title: Is there a setting for Firefox to display scrollbars in 3D?
content:
Very often it happens to me that I'm not able to tell whether I'm at the beginning or at the end of a document. The scrollbar colors displayed by Firefox do not provide enough distinctive information to tell. (See images attached.)

From the 80's 'til the 10's we had 3D scrollbars with outset borders giving the impression of a raised scrollbar … for a reason.

Is there a setting to have Firefox display 3D scrollbars on Windows?

title: embedded youtube videos do not play
content:
I cannot play embedded Youtube videos, but they work when I open them in Youtube.

What I tried so far: 1. turning off hardware acceleration 2. private window 3. troubleshoot mode

The issue has been going on since a long time already, and present on both Windows and Linux Ubuntu.

title: Restoring pages when not asked to restore them
content: How to avoid Firefox restoring previous tabs when starting up. I've read about several solutions (all I could find) that don't work for me. Sometimes I have tens of pages opened and when I close Firefox I don't want 50 pages to be restored. Don't ask me if I have the restore option activated, I haven't. I switched to Nightly to see if it would solve the problem, it did for about 2 months and now it's also happening with Nightly. I have antivirus that include anti-tracking services but I would not know how this could interfere with Firefox settings or if my antivirus has anything to do with it. The issue is so annoying to me that I'm thinking to switch to another browser if I find no solution. I noticed more people complaining about the same issue but it seems not enough for it to be taken seriously in order to solve or be given an explanation. On the other hand it seems not everyone is having the same issue witch makes it even more mind boggling to me. Besides some add-blockers and translation I have no extensions installed. If you happen to know what the issue is I'll be glad to hear from you.

title: My Experience with the Best Numerology Course Online
content:
When I first decided to learn numerology, I wasn’t sure which path to take. There are so many courses available that it can be hard to know which one is truly worth your time and effort. After researching and going through multiple reviews, I finally enrolled in what I now call the Best numerology course online, and the experience was incredible.

The course began with a strong foundation, explaining the core principles of numerology in a way that even a beginner could easily follow. Gradually, it introduced advanced concepts, which made my learning journey smooth and structured. The lessons were detailed yet easy to understand, supported by examples, charts, and practical exercises that helped me apply the knowledge immediately.

One of the things I loved most was the guidance provided by the instructors. Even though it was an online program, I never felt alone in my learning. My questions were always answered promptly, and the interactive community allowed me to connect with fellow learners, share experiences, and practice readings together. What truly set this course apart was its focus on real-life application. I didn’t just learn theories; I learned how to use numerology for personal growth, decision-making, and helping others. By the end, I felt confident enough to perform accurate readings and even offer consultations.

If you are looking for the best numerology course online, I highly recommend considering the one offered by Bhartiya Institute of Vedic Science. It is well-structured, beginner-friendly, and comprehensive enough for those who want to go deeper into the subject.

Overall, this course has been a life-changing experience for me — one that has not only given me a new skill but also opened my mind to a fascinating world of numbers and their hidden meanings.

title: Disable Auto Suggestions
content:
I'm in the midst of getting used to a new computer and setting it up as I want and like it. (My old one just stopped dead and nothing could be retrieved from it.) My question: how does one stop Google from auto suggesting in Firefox? See the attached photo...I've typed a "g" and there's a whole list of useless suggestions shown. Based on what I've read, I've turned off what I think are all the settings relating to auto suggestions yet it's still operational. Previously, I never had this problem with Firefox, but now with the new machine (HP using Windows 11) it's back to haunt me. Thanks for any assistance.

cheers, Iain.

title: Firefox kills audio driver, causing computer to become silent
content:
Note:Translation of questions from DEEPL Laptop system version: Windows 10, 21H2, 19044.6093. Firefox version: 141.0.3 (64-bit) The laptop has 16GB of RAM, an AMD 4600H processor, and a GTX 1650 graphics card.

When opening web pages in Firefox (this time it crashed after opening three regular pages), there is a chance it will freeze with a white screen and display a “not responding” pop-up window, while also causing the system audio driver to malfunction. Clicking the speaker icon in the bottom-right corner takes a long time to display the volume slider, but the slider cannot be moved, or adjusting the volume does not produce any sound. Forcing Firefox to close and reopening it also causes it to freeze. The only way to avoid the white screen and unresponsive state is for Firefox to automatically detect the crash and prompt whether to open a new page. The audio driver issue requires restarting the computer to resolve. So what is the underlying issue? How can I report this bug to the official team for analysis and resolution? If it's difficult to resolve, I'll consider switching to the ESR version of Firefox.

(Annoying past experience: This situation has occurred several times before when using Firefox. At that time, I had 2-3 web pages with videos open, mainly video websites, and the speaker icon was directly crossed out with an X, causing the computer desktop to crash as well. The computer became extremely laggy, and the Task Manager and security options were difficult to open. After restarting the computer, Firefox automatically reopened the previously unclosed page, causing the desktop to crash immediately upon startup, entering a loop. It seemed that even Windows Safe Mode didn't work, and a forced upgrade to a major Windows version was required to resolve the issue, followed by reinstalling a bunch of software.)

title: Using canvas/context to scale an image that displays ok before removes the image data, ok in Chome/Safari.
content:
The app sizes two adjacent images to the same height. Maybe there's a better approach?

This works, in that I see the original image displayed at the wrong size: 

   //img.src = imgsrc.src;

This sizes the image but without the data (black square for toDataURL w/ image/jpeg) in FF, but not Chrome and Safari: 

   var canvas = document.createElement( 'canvas' );    canvas.width = width;    canvas.height = avail_height;    var context = canvas.getContext( '2d' ); 
   // Tried/failed: Fill white background for JPEG export    //context.fillStyle = '#fff';    //context.fillRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height); 
   context.drawImage( imgsrc, 0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);    context.lineWidth = 150; // ?? 
   img.src = canvas.toDataURL('image/jpeg', 0.92);    img.onmousedown = disableDragging; // for FF    img.style.opacity = "1.0"

The page is the view.html one gets to via Enter on phobrain.com.
creator: phobrain

title: cant disable translation
content:
i went to about:config -> browser.translations.enable and also browser.translations.automaticallyPopup , making sure it reads "false", and also went to Firefox Menu > Settings > General > Language and Appearance and under Languages the only language other than spanish (the language i want the browser to be) is english (maybe that way it recognizes it as an "allowed" language or something and doesnt translate from it)

...but it still translates pages from english (sometimes even translating the search result and directing me to a translate-version of the page instead of to the the page itself).

how can i make it not translate things from english anymore? (if the only solution is to stop translating altogether from any language, i'll gladly take it as long as it stops translating from english)
creator: mrblackfiredragon

title: Flickering in upper right screen
content:
I found a problem with McAfee Webadvisor 13 Aug 2025 release. It causes flickering in the upper right part of the screen. Disabling it in Extensions fixes the problem. Removing it and reinstalling causes the problem to reoccur. This is new, had no problems yesterday but today all four of my family's computers have this problem. I will report the problem to McAfee and give an update if I get a response.

Tony D.
